lines.text: Enter CINNA the poet

lines.speaker: cinna the poet
lines.text: I dreamt tonight that I did feast with Caesar, And things unlucky charge my fantasy: I have no will to wander forth of doors, Yet something leads me forth.
Enter Citizens

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: What is your name

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: Whither are you going

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Where do you dwell

lines.speaker: fourth citizen
lines.text: Are you a married man or a bachelor

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: Answer every man directly.

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: Ay, and briefly.

lines.speaker: fourth citizen
lines.text: Ay, and wisely.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Ay, and truly, you were best.

lines.speaker: cinna the poet
lines.text: What is my name Whither am I going Where do I dwell Am I a married man or a bachelor Then, to answer every man directly and briefly, wisely and truly: wisely I say, I am a bachelor.

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: Thats as much as to say, they are fools that marry: youll bear me a bang for that, I fear. Proceed directly.

lines.speaker: cinna the poet
lines.text: Directly, I am going to Caesars funeral.

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: As a friend or an enemy

lines.speaker: cinna the poet
lines.text: As a friend.

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: That matter is answered directly.

lines.speaker: fourth citizen
lines.text: For your dwelling,briefly.

lines.speaker: cinna the poet
lines.text: Briefly, I dwell by the Capitol.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Your name, sir, truly.

lines.speaker: cinna the poet
lines.text: Truly, my name is Cinna.

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: Tear him to pieces hes a conspirator.

lines.speaker: cinna the poet
lines.text: I am Cinna the poet, I am Cinna the poet.

lines.speaker: fourth citizen
lines.text: Tear him for his bad verses, tear him for his bad verses.

lines.speaker: cinna the poet
lines.text: I am not Cinna the conspirator.

lines.speaker: fourth citizen
lines.text: It is no matter, his names Cinna pluck but his name out of his heart, and turn him going.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Tear him, tear him! Come, brands ho! firebrands: to Brutus, to Cassius burn all: some to Decius house, and some to Cascas some to Ligarius: away, go!
Exeunt
